faqs.q: What is the best roofing material for Houston's weather?
faqs.a: High-quality asphalt shingles (like architectural or impact-resistant) are popular for their balance of cost and durability. Metal roofing is also an excellent long-term choice for Texas heat.

faqs.q: How do I know if I need a full replacement or just a repair?
faqs.a: If your roof is over 20 years old, has widespread shingle loss, or has suffered major storm damage, a replacement is usually more cost-effective than constant repairs.

faqs.q: What are the signs of hail damage on a roof?
faqs.a: Signs include circular indentations (bruising) in shingles, heavy granule loss in gutters, and cracked or dented metal flashing.
